doc.title: JPM APAC Technology - Hon Hai/ASE/Alchip
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/JPM APAC Technology - Hon HaiASEAlchipJPM APAC Technology - Hon HaiASEAlchip_2025-08-29

passages.text: Gokul recaps largely positive meetings from our Taiwan tech tour w/ Hon Hai, ASE and Alchip. Hon Hai was viewed by investors as incrementally positive given further GPU, ASIC and sovereign AI wins, and even guided towards potentially half the AI server board market share. May imply some upside to investor models as confirms sense is out- executing the competition. Gokul continued to push ASE on raising pricing as co confirmed ASP upward reversions w/ new products which can provide some upside to earnings which is not fully modeled by the street nor sense from investors. Final test AI GPU market share gain vs KYEC remains a key investor debate, as ASE FY26 baseline share is generally considered to be \(\sim 30\%\) . Lastly, Alchip 2nm AI Accelerator (AWS) project win has been flagged in prior calls including 2Q and at our conference. MRVL miss and guidance is not a surprise to Asian investors given Alchip hold on AWS

- Hon Hai (OW PT NT\$240): share expansion in AI servers w/ new clients for GPU, ASICs - Gokul Hariharan link- ASE (OW PT NT\$170): heavy capex to align w/ customer FY26 project requests - Gokul Hariharan link- Alchip (OW PT NT\$4,750): 2nm AI accelerator project kicking-in in 4Q - Gokul Hariharan link- Silergy (OW PT NT\$500): lower FY25 growth, strong FY26 outlook w/ more meaningful auto content growth - William Yang link- NVDA F2Q key takeaways - Gokul Hariharan link- Huaqin (OW PT -> Rmb115): strong 1H growth across segments; optimistic on AI momentum and outlook - Cherry Liu link- Luxshare (OW PT -> Rmb62): rising contribution from strong auto/comms - Billy Feng link
Use the links below to jump straight to each section: Detailed Highlights Sector Key Newsflow Full Research Links Corporate Access Earnings Calendar
Hon Hai (OW PT NT\$240): share expansion in AI servers w/ new clients for GPU, ASICs - Gokul Hariharan link

- HOM Hai expects to gain share continuously, going from 2 CSP customers in GB200 (we believe MSFT, ORCL) to 3 CSPs in GB300 (we expect Meta) and adding one more in Vera Rubin (we expect Google). Hon Hai also expects to expand its customer base in ASIC from one to 3 customers in FY25- Extending value chain presence to L11+ would likely lift LT margins: Hon Hai extending AI server value chain form L11- > H11+ thru a partnership w/ Teco and further vertical integration into data center infrastructure components - sources power supplies from vendors as Delta. Enhances value capture- More positive on sovereign AI, FY26 likely revenue contribution: believes the co will capture significant share in this category, w/ some projects already ramping, contributing to FY26 rev. Positive on Ohio Stargate - we estimate could represent 70k GB200 equivalent compute demand racks over many years

- Large US expansion, India smartphone progressing smoothly, likely account \(20\%\) of FY25 total iPhone- Investor feedback: incrementally positive given further GPU, ASIC and sovereign AI wins, and even guided towards potentially half the market share. Confirmed investors' sense is out-executing the competition and may imply some upside to models

- Mgmt. guided no sharp decrease in FY26 machinery capex expected as will continue spending on oS (on substrate), full-stack 2.5D advanced packaging and testing in FY26-27- Full process leading edge advanced packaging picking up. Full process (FoCoS + Bridge) a small part of revs but could surpass oS we believe possibly in FY27- Major AI GPU final testing revenue to start from 4Q; guides ASIC customers: potential AI GPU final testing starting in 4Q. Expects higher share in Rubin in FY26 w/ over more than one ASIC customer. Share vs KYEC has been widely watched by investors. Chip probing related projects for AI have already started ramping since early FY25 mostly from TSMC in our view.- Price increases to wait for new project kick-off, environment appears favorable to us: states meaningful increases in adjustments may have to wait until new product introductions, w/ more discussions expected in FY26. We believe ASE should be able to raise pricing on several leading edge advanced packaging and HPC projects given strong fabless, design service vendors' demand. Smaller volume projects in flip chip packaging, testing and LEAP. This has been a major issue which Gokul has been pushing and not consensus- Investor feedback: plenty of investor debate on KYEC vs ASE final test AI GPU share into FY26, \(30\%\) seems a baseline. Gokul continues to push the co on raising pricing as his view is not fully consensus among his peers nor fully modeled by investors. Price hikes / ASP upward reversions w/ new products can be accretive to earnings and serve as an upside catalyst

- Co appears quite confident about winning the 2nm AI accelerator (AWS) project. NRE revenue expected to begin by year-end, multiple tape-outs needed. Mass production likely FY28 at earliest. Mgmt. expressed strong confidence about third-party IP readiness, which was an issue in the prior generation - and a question among investors. Notes Synopsys and Cadence are focused in this area, and key clients stick to same vendors for multiple design cycles- Competing for another CSP on AI accelerator project: expressed optimism about being invited to compete. Highly complex project involving 3.5D packaging, main comps Broadcom, MediaTek, likely Marvell. We believe is likely for a US social media CSP AI ASIC (Meta), but we do not believe Alchip has a high chance of winning given the high complexity. Investors are not modeling this incremental win- Auto ADAS project on track w/ more engagements: major ADAS project w/ a China EV maker (we believe Li Auto) commence in 4Q, w/ growth into FY26. Guides FY26 revenue \(300 - 400m (10 - 15\%)\) . Next-gen 5nm likely to commence design work soon. Engaging w/ additional Chinese automakers, thou no confirmation of design wins yet- Investor feedback: 2nm AI Accelerator (AWS) project win has been flagged in prior calls including 2Q and at our conference. MB/L miss and guidance is not a surprise to Asian investors given Alchip hold on AWS

- We revise down FY25 YoY growth due to demand slowdown. We do look for a 2H pickup. For FY26 we see stronger growth potential from auto biz, driven by meaningful content value increases from new products as MCU. Server biz may have some breakthroughs w/ new chip customer's adoption

- We lower FY25/26 EPS \(-31\% / - 15\% \sim \text{IT} 5.7.5 / \text{NT} 5.14\) due to lower growth; intro FY27 EPS NT\(19.3 implying +34\%\) YoY growth driven by stronger auto, server biz- Investor feedback: divided as high valuation vs global peers as sole main Taiwan domestic analog player as story is predicated on China share gains.

- RTX6000D remains on track: we continue to see an aggressive build plan in C2H at \(\sim 1.5\mathrm{m}\) units, which is not restricted to US licensing approval. Can offset H20, expect system shipments from 4Q - beneficiaries Huaqin, Inspur, VNET, GDS- Strong long-term growth: we maintain FY25 rack shipments, FY26 expect to reach \(\sim 50\mathrm{k}\) - Smooth transition into GB300, Rubin mass production on track for 2H26. Nvidia has been tens of billions of dollars of GB300 revenues in Jul-Q w/ smooth rack-level system ramp. We expect TSMC to start Rubin production in 2Q26, which would precipitate a Hynix HBM4 contract signing. We expect a smooth GB300 transition to Vera Rubin, which bodes well for Hon Hai, Quanta, Wistron as expect server mass production into 2H26. Strong performance upgrades bode well for component vendors as power - Delta, substrate - Unimicron, and CCL - EMC- Exponential networking revenue growth on growing GPU cluster size. Momentum likely to sustain given GB200/300 NVL72 ramp in 2H. As GPU clusters grow w/ higher number of GPUs and switches, this drives rising interconnection demand inside- and inter-rack driving scale-up and scale-out across datacenters. Key beneficiaries optical component vendors Innolight, cable/connector vendors Bizlink, Amphenol, TE Connectivity- We believe NVDA maintains a strong complete solution vs ASICs. For FY26, we do expect the GOOG TPU supply chain to see the fastest growth among AI Accelerators - Broadcom primary beneficiary
Huaqin (OW PT - > Rmb115): strong 1H growth across segments; optimistic on AI momentum and outlook - Cherry Liu link

- 1H strong +46% yoy earnings growth driven by accelerating AI server delivery, strong smartphone/PC/wearables. Mgmt. expects FY25 >Rmb40bn datacenter revenue w/ further growth given China CSPs continuous demand w/ potential share gain- Investor feedback: Huaqin has underperformed Inspur due to limited revenue exposure to domestic GPU platforms. This has been an investor concern and we expect Huaqin to ramp domestic GPU platforms. A major beneficiary once new NVDA GPU platforms are approved into China and benefits from NVDA RTX6000D shipments along w/ Inspur

- During the call, mgmt. stated 1H saw strong auto/comms segment growth which is margin accretive and boost growth.- Luxshare achieved progress on design wins in smart driving.- We project FY24-27 EPS growth, raise PT - > Rmb63 given stronger auto/comms, upbeat 2H iPhone volume- Investor feedback: auto + comms which benefits from AI datacenter growth are two new upside drivers for investors to consider, as traditionally has been viewed as an iPhone assembler

- Asus Prepares Xbox Ally Gadget to Take Microsoft Gaming Mobile (Bloomberg)- Infosys, Mastercard Collaborate to Streamline Cross-Border Payments (MT Newswires)- Tokyo Electron says it has no organisational role in TSMC trade secrets case; Taiwan prosecutors indict three people for stealing TSMC trade secrets to help its supplier Tokyo Electron (Reuters)- SMIC's bid to double 7-nm chip production sees stock surge over 10pc (The Standard)- Nvidia's \(50bn China opportunity, TSMC dumps China tools (FT)
Specialist Sales APAC Specialist Sales 29 August 2025
- China EV Battery: Europe Needs China for EV Battery Industry Success (BNEF Bloomberg)

(NTAP US) - F1Q26 Review: Executing to Plan with Greater Visibility Through the Pipeline Supporting Likelihood of Upsides to Come; Reiterate OW- Samik Chatterjee (Link)- NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA US) - Blackwell/Blackwell Ultra Ramp and Networking Strength Drive Solid Results/ Guidance; H20 Upside Still Likely in the Cards, in Our View; Reit OW- Harlan Sur (Link)
